name: IMANA
mission: IMANA FOSTERS HEALTH PROMOTION, DISEASE PREVENTION, AND HEALTH MAINTENANCE IN COMMUNITIES AROUND THE WORLD THROUGH DIRECT PATIENT CARE, HEALTH PROGRAMS, AND ADVOCACY.

evaluationSources: Listed in Combined Federal Campaign (Federal Government (Combined Federal Campaign))

zakatClaimEvidence: Donations made to IMANA Medical Relief are Zakat Eligible. Donate your Zakat. (Source: https://imana.org/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 44/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: Beneficiary count appears implausible; CPB excluded pending review
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Separate restricted/endowment funds from operating reserves and publish a clear reserve-use policy.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Medical Association of North America shows exceptional alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Donations made to IMANA Medical Relief are Zakat Eligible. Donate your Zakat. (Source: https://imana.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: IMANA holds a 99.75/100 rating and holds 33.0 months of working capital with a 68.7% program expense ratio.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,874,345 and operates programs including ServeRohingya and ServeIndia.
IMANA provides donation options that are Zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: IMANA demonstrates high financial accountability and strong alignment for Muslim donors, though its overall impact score is moderated by the direct provision nature of its work and data availability.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 68.7% is lower than some top-tier peer organizations
Limited external data regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a high alignment score of 44/50, IMANA offers a strong fit for donors seeking to support urgent global health causes through a Zakat-eligible framework [1][3]. The organization's long-standing track record in disaster relief and medical missions reinforces its reliability within the community [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: IMANA achieved a total revenue of $2,874,345 to fund its global health programs, maintaining a program expense ratio of 68.7% [1][2]. While the organization provides direct medical care, the impact score of 26/50 reflects a need for more granular evidence on cost-effectiveness per beneficiary [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Medical Association of North America (IMANA) provides critical global healthcare relief and health promotion through a network of medical professionals.
strengths: Exceptional financial health and transparency with a Charity Navigator score of 99.75/100
Strong liquidity position with 33.0 months of working capital available
High fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.13 to raise every dollar
baseline_narrative.summary: IMANA fosters health maintenance and disease prevention worldwide through direct patient care and targeted initiatives such as ServeRohingya, ServePakistan, and ServeIndia [1][2]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through medical humanitarian aid [3].

all_citations.quote: Geographic Coverage: Bangladesh, Guyana, India, Mauritania, Palestine, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Uganda, Yemen

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: IMANA demonstrates high financial accountability and strong alignment for Muslim donors, though its overall impact score is moderated by the direct provision nature of its work and data availability.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization's <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 68.7%</cite> is lower than the <cite id="2">peer median of 88.2%</cite>.
There is limited external data regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics, making it difficult to assess the full impact of donations.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains exceptional financial health and transparency ratings, suggesting strong overall management despite the lower program ratio.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 68.7%</cite> is below the peer median of 88.2%
case_against.summary: The primary concern for donors is the organization's program expense ratio, which is lower than many peer organizations.

confidence.notes: Strong data availability for financials and ratings, but lacking detailed impact metrics.

alignment.explanation: The organization is highly aligned with Muslim donor priorities, operating in Muslim-majority regions and accepting zakat for eligible categories such as <cite id="3">fuqara and masakin</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust IMANA due to its <cite id="1">99.75/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
credibility.improvement: To further strengthen credibility, IMANA could publish more detailed impact reports and independent evaluations of its programs.

impact.explanation: IMANA delivers impact through direct provision of medical care, though its <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 68.7%</cite> is below the peer median.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provision rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: The Islamic Medical Association of North America (IMANA) provides critical global healthcare relief and health promotion through a network of medical professionals.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support medical humanitarian relief and value organizations with strong financial transparency and governance.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations through medical aid
Value high financial transparency and accountability ratings
Care about providing healthcare to underserved populations globally
giving_considerations: Program expense ratio is lower than some peers
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations with the highest possible program expense ratios or those requiring rigorous academic evidence of cost-effectiveness.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks some outcome metrics through Candid but lacks rigorous external evaluations or cost-per-beneficiary data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: IMANA creates impact by mobilizing medical professionals to provide direct patient care and health programs in underserved communities globally.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real impact and allows donors to compare the cost-effectiveness of different interventions.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The organization has significant working capital but has experienced a decline in revenue over the past three years, suggesting room for additional funding to expand programs.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Multiple countries including Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Yemen

peer_comparison.differentiator: IMANA distinguishes itself through its specific focus on mobilizing medical professionals for humanitarian relief.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on healthcare direct and humanitarian relief, same size
similar_organizations.name: SAPA

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on healthcare direct, same size
similar_organizations.name: Khalil Center

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on healthcare direct and humanitarian relief, but larger organization
similar_organizations.name: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION

strengths.detail: IMANA has earned a <cite id="1">99.75/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong accountability and governance practices.
The organization maintains <cite id="1">33.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant financial stability to sustain operations during economic downturns.
IMANA is highly efficient in its fundraising efforts, spending only <cite id="1">$0.13 per $1 raised</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: IMANA demonstrates a strong commitment to financial health and transparency. The organization's <cite id="1">99.75/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> is supported by perfect beacon scores in Impact, Culture, and Leadership. Furthermore, IMANA maintains a robust liquidity position with <cite id="1">33.0 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring the organization can continue its critical medical relief work even during periods of financial uncertainty. The charity is also highly efficient in its fundraising, spending just <cite id="1">$0.13 per $1 raised</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Islamic Medical Association of North America (IMANA) fosters health promotion, disease prevention, and health maintenance in communities around the world through direct patient care and health programs. The organization reported <cite id="2">$2,874,345 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. IMANA maintains a strong reputation for accountability, holding a <cite id="1">99.75/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. The organization operates in multiple countries, including <cite id="3">Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, and Yemen</cite>, providing critical medical relief to underserved populations.
